meanings.definition: To take part in an activity in a casual or superficial way.
meanings.sent1: She would dabble in painting occasionally.
meanings.sent2: He liked to dabble in different hobbies without committing fully.
meanings.sent3: The cat would dabble with the yarn but never finish a project.
meanings.sent4: Her interest in photography was just a dabble compared to her passion for music.
meanings.sent5: They would dabble in gardening, planting a few flowers here and there.

meanings.definition: To splash or play in water.
meanings.sent1: The kids love to dabble in the shallow end of the pool.
meanings.sent2: The ducks dabble in the pond, searching for food.
meanings.sent3: The puppy would dabble in the puddles after the rain.
meanings.sent4: The sunlight danced on the water as the fish dabble below.
meanings.sent5: The children would dabble in the stream, giggling as they splashed around.

meanings.definition: To work at anything in an irregular or superficial manner.
meanings.sent1: He would dabble in fixing the car but never really knew what he was doing.
meanings.sent2: She would dabble in cooking, trying out new recipes now and then.
meanings.sent3: The student would dabble in studying, never focusing for long.
meanings.sent4: The writer would dabble in different genres, experimenting with each one.
meanings.sent5: They would dabble in DIY projects, starting many but finishing few.
